fields.name: after

fields.name: asPatch

fields.description: The older/lower snapshot to compare against.

fields.name: export

args.name: path

fields.name: id

fields.name: isEmpty
fields.description: Returns true if the changeset is empty (i.e. there are no changes).

fields.name: layer
fields.description: Return a snapshot containing only the created and modified files

fields.name: modifiedPaths
fields.description: Files and directories that existed before and were updated in the newer directory.

fields.name: removedPaths
fields.description: Files and directories that were removed. Directories are indicated by a trailing slash, and their child paths are not included.

fields.name: sync
fields.description: Force evaluation in the engine.

types.name: Container
types.description: An OCI-compatible container, also known as a Docker container.

fields.name: asService
fields.description:
Turn the container into a Service.

Be sure to set any exposed ports before this conversion.

args.name: args
args.description:
Command to run instead of the container's default command (e.g., ["go", "run", "main.go"]).

If empty, the container's default command is used.

args.name: useEntrypoint
args.description: If the container has an entrypoint, prepend it to the args.

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description: Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the args according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

args.name: noInit
args.description:
If set, skip the automatic init process injected into containers by default.

This should only be used if the user requires that their exec process be the pid 1 process in the container. Otherwise it may result in unexpected behavior.

fields.name: asTarball
fields.description: Package the container state as an OCI image, and return it as a tar archive

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform images.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the image's layers.

Defaults to OCI, which is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed for older runtimes without OCI support.

fields.name: combinedOutput
fields.description:
The combined buffered standard output and standard error stream of the last executed command

Returns an error if no command was executed

fields.name: defaultArgs
fields.description: Return the container's default arguments.

fields.name: directory
fields.description:
Retrieve a directory from the container's root filesystem

Mounts are included.

args.name: path
args.description: The path of the directory to retrieve (e.g., "./src").

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

fields.name: entrypoint
fields.description: Return the container's OCI entrypoint.

fields.name: envVariable
fields.description: Retrieves the value of the specified environment variable.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the environment variable to retrieve (e.g., "PATH").

fields.name: envVariables
fields.description: Retrieves the list of environment variables passed to commands.

fields.name: exists
fields.description: check if a file or directory exists

args.name: path
args.description: Path to check (e.g., "/file.txt").

args.name: expectedType
args.description: If specified, also validate the type of file (e.g. "REGULAR_TYPE", "DIRECTORY_TYPE", or "SYMLINK_TYPE").

args.name: doNotFollowSymlinks
args.description: If specified, do not follow symlinks.

fields.name: exitCode
fields.description:
The exit code of the last executed command

Returns an error if no command was executed

fields.name: experimentalWithAllGPUs
fields.description:
EXPERIMENTAL API! Subject to change/removal at any time.

Configures all available GPUs on the host to be accessible to this container.

This currently works for Nvidia devices only.

fields.name: experimentalWithGPU
fields.description:
EXPERIMENTAL API! Subject to change/removal at any time.

Configures the provided list of devices to be accessible to this container.

This currently works for Nvidia devices only.

args.name: devices
args.description: List of devices to be accessible to this container.

fields.name: export
fields.description:
Writes the container as an OCI tarball to the destination file path on the host.

It can also export platform variants.

args.name: path
args.description:
Host's destination path (e.g., "./tarball").

Path can be relative to the engine's workdir or absolute.

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform image.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the exported image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the exported image's layers.

Defaults to OCI, which is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed for older runtimes without OCI support.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

fields.name: exportImage
fields.description: Exports the container as an image to the host's container image store.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of image to export to in the host's store

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform image.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the exported image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the exported image's layers.

Defaults to OCI, which is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed for older runtimes without OCI support.

fields.name: exposedPorts
fields.description:
Retrieves the list of exposed ports.

This includes ports already exposed by the image, even if not explicitly added with dagger.

fields.name: file
fields.description:
Retrieves a file at the given path.

Mounts are included.

args.name: path
args.description: The path of the file to retrieve (e.g., "./README.md").

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo.txt").

fields.name: from
fields.description: Download a container image, and apply it to the container state. All previous state will be lost.

args.name: address
args.description: Address of the container image to download, in standard OCI ref format. Example:"registry.dagger.io/engine:latest"

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Container.

fields.name: imageRef
fields.description: The unique image reference which can only be retrieved immediately after the 'Container.From' call.

fields.name: import
fields.description: Reads the container from an OCI tarball.

args.name: source
args.description: File to read the container from.

args.name: tag
args.description: Identifies the tag to import from the archive, if the archive bundles multiple tags.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Retrieves the value of the specified label.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the label (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").

fields.name: labels
fields.description: Retrieves the list of labels passed to container.

fields.name: mounts
fields.description: Retrieves the list of paths where a directory is mounted.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The platform this container executes and publishes as.

fields.name: publish
fields.description:
Package the container state as an OCI image, and publish it to a registry

Returns the fully qualified address of the published image, with digest

args.name: address
args.description:
The OCI address to publish to

Same format as "docker push". Example: "registry.example.com/user/repo:tag"

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform image.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the published image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the published image's layers.

Defaults to "OCI", which is compatible with most recent registries, but "Docker" may be needed for older registries without OCI support.

fields.name: rootfs
fields.description: Return a snapshot of the container's root filesystem. The snapshot can be modified then written back using withRootfs. Use that method for filesystem modifications.

fields.name: stat
fields.description: Return file status

args.name: path
args.description: Path to check (e.g., "/file.txt").

args.name: doNotFollowSymlinks
args.description: If specified, do not follow symlinks.

fields.name: stderr
fields.description:
The buffered standard error stream of the last executed command

Returns an error if no command was executed

fields.name: stdout
fields.description:
The buffered standard output stream of the last executed command

Returns an error if no command was executed

fields.name: sync
fields.description:
Forces evaluation of the pipeline in the engine.

It doesn't run the default command if no exec has been set.

fields.name: terminal
fields.description: Opens an interactive terminal for this container using its configured default terminal command if not overridden by args (or sh as a fallback default).

args.name: cmd
args.description: If set, override the container's default terminal command and invoke these command arguments instead.

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description: Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

fields.name: up
fields.description:
Starts a Service and creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the caller's network to that service.

Be sure to set any exposed ports before calling this api.

args.name: random
args.description: Bind each tunnel port to a random port on the host.

args.name: ports
args.description:
List of frontend/backend port mappings to forward.

Frontend is the port accepting traffic on the host, backend is the service port.

args.name: args
args.description:
Command to run instead of the container's default command (e.g., ["go", "run", "main.go"]).

If empty, the container's default command is used.

args.name: useEntrypoint
args.description: If the container has an entrypoint, prepend it to the args.

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description: Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the args according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

args.name: noInit
args.description:
If set, skip the automatic init process injected into containers by default.

This should only be used if the user requires that their exec process be the pid 1 process in the container. Otherwise it may result in unexpected behavior.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Retrieves the user to be set for all commands.

fields.name: withAnnotation
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the given OCI anotation.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the annotation.

args.name: value
args.description: The value of the annotation.

fields.name: withDefaultArgs
fields.description: Configures default arguments for future commands. Like CMD in Dockerfile.

args.name: args
args.description: Arguments to prepend to future executions (e.g., ["-v", "--no-cache"]).

fields.name: withDefaultTerminalCmd
fields.description: Set the default command to invoke for the container's terminal API.

args.name: args
args.description: The args of the command.

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description: Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

fields.name: withDirectory
fields.description: Return a new container snapshot, with a directory added to its filesystem

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written directory (e.g., "/tmp/directory").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the directory to write

args.name: exclude
args.description: Patterns to exclude in the written directory (e.g. ["node_modules/**", ".gitignore", ".git/"]).

args.name: include
args.description: Patterns to include in the written directory (e.g. ["*.go", "go.mod", "go.sum"]).

args.name: gitignore
args.description: Apply .gitignore rules when writing the directory.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the directory and its contents.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

fields.name: withEntrypoint
fields.description: Set an OCI-style entrypoint. It will be included in the container's OCI configuration. Note, withExec ignores the entrypoint by default.

args.name: args
args.description: Arguments of the entrypoint. Example: ["go", "run"].

args.name: keepDefaultArgs
args.description: Don't reset the default arguments when setting the entrypoint. By default it is reset, since entrypoint and default args are often tightly coupled.

fields.name: withEnvFileVariables
fields.description: Export environment variables from an env-file to the container.

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the envfile

fields.name: withEnvVariable
fields.description: Set a new environment variable in the container.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of the environment variable (e.g., "HOST").

args.name: value
args.description: Value of the environment variable. (e.g., "localhost").

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/opt/bin:$PATH").

fields.name: withError
fields.description: Raise an error.

args.name: err
args.description: Message of the error to raise. If empty, the error will be ignored.

fields.name: withExec
fields.description: Execute a command in the container, and return a new snapshot of the container state after execution.

args.name: args
args.description:
Command to execute. Must be valid exec() arguments, not a shell command. Example: ["go", "run", "main.go"].

To run a shell command, execute the shell and pass the shell command as argument. Example: ["sh", "-c", "ls -l | grep foo"]

Defaults to the container's default arguments (see "defaultArgs" and "withDefaultArgs").

args.name: useEntrypoint
args.description: Apply the OCI entrypoint, if present, by prepending it to the args. Ignored by default.

args.name: stdin
args.description: Content to write to the command's standard input. Example: "Hello world")

args.name: redirectStdin
args.description: Redirect the command's standard input from a file in the container. Example: "./stdin.txt"

args.name: redirectStdout
args.description: Redirect the command's standard output to a file in the container. Example: "./stdout.txt"

args.name: redirectStderr
args.description: Redirect the command's standard error to a file in the container. Example: "./stderr.txt"

args.name: expect
args.description: Exit codes this command is allowed to exit with without error

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description: Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description:
Execute the command with all root capabilities. Like --privileged in Docker

DANGER: this grants the command full access to the host system. Only use when 1) you trust the command being executed and 2) you specifically need this level of access.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the args according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

args.name: noInit
args.description:
Skip the automatic init process injected into containers by default.

Only use this if you specifically need the command to be pid 1 in the container. Otherwise it may result in unexpected behavior. If you're not sure, you don't need this.

fields.name: withExposedPort
fields.description:
Expose a network port. Like EXPOSE in Dockerfile (but with healthcheck support)

Exposed ports serve two purposes:

- For health checks and introspection, when running services

- For setting the EXPOSE OCI field when publishing the container

args.name: port
args.description: Port number to expose. Example: 8080

args.name: protocol
args.description: Network protocol. Example: "tcp"

args.name: description
args.description: Port description. Example: "payment API endpoint"

args.name: experimentalSkipHealthcheck
args.description: Skip the health check when run as a service.

fields.name: withFile
fields.description: Return a container snapshot with a file added

args.name: path
args.description: Path of the new file. Example: "/path/to/new-file.txt"

args.name: source
args.description: File to add

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permissions of the new file. Example: 0600

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo.txt").

fields.name: withFiles
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the contents of the given files copied to the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location where copied files should be placed (e.g., "/src").

args.name: sources
args.description: Identifiers of the files to copy.

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the copied files (e.g., 0600).

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the files.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo.txt").

fields.name: withLabel
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the given label.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the label (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").

args.name: value
args.description: The value of the label (e.g., "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z").

fields.name: withMountedCache
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a cache volume mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the cache directory (e.g., "/root/.npm").

args.name: cache
args.description: Identifier of the cache volume to mount.

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the directory to use as the cache volume's root.

args.name: sharing
args.description: Sharing mode of the cache volume.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted cache directory.

Note that this changes the ownership of the specified mount along with the initial filesystem provided by source (if any). It does not have any effect if/when the cache has already been created.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

fields.name: withMountedDirectory
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a directory mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the mounted directory (e.g., "/mnt/directory").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the mounted directory.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted directory and its contents.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" in the value of path according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g. "/$VAR/foo").

fields.name: withMountedFile
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a file mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the mounted file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the mounted file.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user or user:group to set for the mounted file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: expand

args.description: Replace "${VAR}" or "$VAR" with the value of other vars

args.value: "Variable expansion is now enabled by default"

args.deprecationReason: Variable expansion is now enabled by default

fields.name: asJSON
fields.description: Parse the file contents as JSON.

fields.name: chown
fields.description: Change the owner of the file recursively.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the file.

The user and group must be an ID (1000:1000), not a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: contents
fields.description: Retrieves the contents of the file.

args.name: offsetLines
args.description: Start reading after this line

args.name: limitLines
args.description: Maximum number of lines to read

fields.name: digest
fields.description: Return the file's digest. The format of the digest is not guaranteed to be stable between releases of Dagger. It is guaranteed to be stable between invocations of the same Dagger engine.

args.name: excludeMetadata
args.description: If true, exclude metadata from the digest.

fields.name: export
fields.description: Writes the file to a file path on the host.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written directory (e.g., "output.txt").

args.name: allowParentDirPath
args.description: If allowParentDirPath is true, the path argument can be a directory path, in which case the file will be created in that directory.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this File.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Retrieves the name of the file.

fields.name: search
fields.description:
Searches for content matching the given regular expression or literal string.

Uses Rust regex syntax; escape literal ., [, ], {, }, | with backslashes.

args.name: pattern
args.description: The text to match.

args.name: literal
args.description: Interpret the pattern as a literal string instead of a regular expression.

args.name: multiline
args.description: Enable searching across multiple lines.

args.name: dotall
args.description: Allow the . pattern to match newlines in multiline mode.

args.name: insensitive
args.description: Enable case-insensitive matching.

args.name: skipIgnored
args.description: Honor .gitignore, .ignore, and .rgignore files.

args.name: skipHidden
args.description: Skip hidden files (files starting with .).

args.name: filesOnly
args.description: Only return matching files, not lines and content

args.name: limit
args.description: Limit the number of results to return

fields.name: size
fields.description: Retrieves the size of the file, in bytes.

fields.name: stat
fields.description: Return file status

fields.name: sync
fields.description: Force evaluation in the engine.

fields.name: withName
fields.description: Retrieves this file with its name set to the given name.

args.name: name
args.description: Name to set file to.

fields.name: withReplaced
fields.description:
Retrieves the file with content replaced with the given text.

If 'all' is true, all occurrences of the pattern will be replaced.

If 'firstAfter' is specified, only the first match starting at the specified line will be replaced.

If neither are specified, and there are multiple matches for the pattern, this will error.

If there are no matches for the pattern, this will error.

args.name: search
args.description: The text to match.

args.name: replacement
args.description: The text to match.

args.name: all
args.description: Replace all occurrences of the pattern.

args.name: firstFrom
args.description: Replace the first match starting from the specified line.

fields.name: withTimestamps
fields.description: Retrieves this file with its created/modified timestamps set to the given time.

args.name: timestamp
args.description:
Timestamp to set dir/files in.

Formatted in seconds following Unix epoch (e.g., 1672531199).

fields.name: service
fields.description: Creates a service that forwards traffic to a specified address via the host.

args.name: ports
args.description:
Ports to expose via the service, forwarding through the host network.

If a port's frontend is unspecified or 0, it defaults to the same as the backend port.

An empty set of ports is not valid; an error will be returned.

args.name: host
args.description: Upstream host to forward traffic to.

fields.name: tunnel
fields.description: Creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the host to a service.

args.name: service
args.description: Service to send traffic from the tunnel.

args.name: native
args.description:
Map each service port to the same port on the host, as if the service were running natively.

Note: enabling may result in port conflicts.

args.name: ports
args.description:
Configure explicit port forwarding rules for the tunnel.

If a port's frontend is unspecified or 0, a random port will be chosen by the host.

If no ports are given, all of the service's ports are forwarded. If native is true, each port maps to the same port on the host. If native is false, each port maps to a random port chosen by the host.

If ports are given and native is true, the ports are additive.

fields.name: currentEnv
fields.description:
Returns the current environment

When called from a function invoked via an LLM tool call, this will be the LLM's current environment, including any modifications made through calling tools. Env values returned by functions become the new environment for subsequent calls, and Changeset values returned by functions are applied to the environment's workspace.

When called from a module function outside of an LLM, this returns an Env with the current module installed, and with the current module's source directory as its workspace.

args.value: "Programmatic env access is speculative and might be replaced."

fields.name: module
fields.description: Create a new module.

fields.name: moduleSource
fields.description: Create a new module source instance from a source ref string

args.name: refString
args.description: The string ref representation of the module source

args.name: refPin
args.description: The pinned version of the module source

args.name: disableFindUp
args.description: If true, do not attempt to find dagger.json in a parent directory of the provided path. Only relevant for local module sources.

args.name: allowNotExists
args.description: If true, do not error out if the provided ref string is a local path and does not exist yet. Useful when initializing new modules in directories that don't exist yet.

args.name: requireKind
args.description: If set, error out if the ref string is not of the provided requireKind.

fields.name: secret
fields.description: Creates a new secret.

args.name: uri
args.description: The URI of the secret store

args.name: cacheKey
args.description:
If set, the given string will be used as the cache key for this secret. This means that any secrets with the same cache key will be considered equivalent in terms of cache lookups, even if they have different URIs or plaintext values.

For example, two secrets with the same cache key provided as secret env vars to other wise equivalent containers will result in the container withExecs hitting the cache for each other.

If not set, the cache key for the secret will be derived from its plaintext value as looked up when the secret is constructed.

fields.name: setSecret
fields.description:
Sets a secret given a user defined name to its plaintext and returns the secret.

The plaintext value is limited to a size of 128000 bytes.

args.name: name
args.description: The user defined name for this secret

args.name: plaintext
args.description: The plaintext of the secret

fields.name: sourceMap
fields.description: Creates source map metadata.

args.name: filename
args.description: The filename from the module source.

args.name: line
args.description: The line number within the filename.

args.name: column
args.description: The column number within the line.

types.name: Service
types.description: A content-addressed service providing TCP connectivity.

fields.name: endpoint
fields.description:
Retrieves an endpoint that clients can use to reach this container.

If no port is specified, the first exposed port is used. If none exist an error is returned.

If a scheme is specified, a URL is returned. Otherwise, a host:port pair is returned.

args.name: port
args.description: The exposed port number for the endpoint

args.name: scheme
args.description: Return a URL with the given scheme, eg. http for http://

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: Retrieves a hostname which can be used by clients to reach this container.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Service.

fields.name: ports
fields.description: Retrieves the list of ports provided by the service.

fields.name: start
fields.description:
Start the service and wait for its health checks to succeed.

Services bound to a Container do not need to be manually started.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Stop the service.

args.name: kill
args.description: Immediately kill the service without waiting for a graceful exit

fields.name: sync
fields.description: Forces evaluation of the pipeline in the engine.

fields.name: up
fields.description: Creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the caller's network to this service.

args.name: ports
args.description:
List of frontend/backend port mappings to forward.

Frontend is the port accepting traffic on the host, backend is the service port.

args.name: random
args.description: Bind each tunnel port to a random port on the host.

fields.name: withHostname
fields.description: Configures a hostname which can be used by clients within the session to reach this container.

args.name: hostname
args.description: The hostname to use.

types.description: The `ServiceID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Service.

fields.name: withEnum
fields.description:
Returns a TypeDef of kind Enum with the provided name.

Note that an enum's values may be omitted if the intent is only to refer to an enum. This is how functions are able to return their own, or any other circular reference.

fields.name: withObject

Returns a TypeDef of kind Object with the provided name.

Note that an object's fields and functions may be omitted if the intent is only to refer to an object. This is how functions are able to return their own object, or any other circular reference.

enumValues.name: SCALAR_KIND
enumValues.description: A scalar value of any basic kind.

enumValues.name: LIST_KIND
enumValues.description:
Always paired with a ListTypeDef.

A list of values all having the same type.

enumValues.name: OBJECT_KIND
enumValues.description:
Always paired with an ObjectTypeDef.

A named type defined in the GraphQL schema, with fields and functions.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE_KIND
enumValues.description:
Always paired with an InterfaceTypeDef.

A named type of functions that can be matched+implemented by other objects+interfaces.

enumValues.name: INPUT_KIND
enumValues.description: A graphql input type, used only when representing the core API via TypeDefs.

enumValues.name: VOID_KIND
enumValues.description:
A special kind used to signify that no value is returned.

This is used for functions that have no return value. The outer TypeDef specifying this Kind is always Optional, as the Void is never actually represented.

enumValues.name: ENUM_KIND
enumValues.description:
A GraphQL enum type and its values

Always paired with an EnumTypeDef.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: A scalar value of any basic kind.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
Always paired with a ListTypeDef.

A list of values all having the same type.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
Always paired with an ObjectTypeDef.

A named type defined in the GraphQL schema, with fields and functions.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Always paired with an InterfaceTypeDef.

A named type of functions that can be matched+implemented by other objects+interfaces.

enumValues.name: INPUT
enumValues.description: A graphql input type, used only when representing the core API via TypeDefs.

enumValues.name: VOID
enumValues.description:
A special kind used to signify that no value is returned.

This is used for functions that have no return value. The outer TypeDef specifying this Kind is always Optional, as the Void is never actually represented.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
A GraphQL enum type and its values

Always paired with an EnumTypeDef.

types.name: Void
types.description:
The absence of a value.

A Null Void is used as a placeholder for resolvers that do not return anything.
